title: Glen Johnson makes Manchester United vs Liverpool prediction
text:
Johnson thinks Liverpool will get the job done (Picture: Getty)

Glen Johnson is expecting a routine win for Liverpool against Manchester United on Sunday, although he thinks Ole Gunnar Solskjaer will avoid an ’embarrassing’ result that would cost him his job.

The former Liverpool and Chelsea right-back believes Jurgen Klopp’s attacking trio of Sadio Mane, Roberto Firmino and Mohamed Salah will overwhelm United’s defence, while they will have few issues dealing with United’s limp attack.

While Liverpool are chasing an 18th consecutive Premier League victory, United are just one point above the relegation zone after a miserable start to the 2019/20 season.

Will Solskjaer avoid a heavy defeat? (Picture: Getty)

And Johnson isn’t expecting a change in fortune for either side on Sunday.

‘The only way it won’t end in Liverpool victory is if they don’t perform,’ Johnson told The Mirror. ‘If they play anywhere near how they have been this season I think they will put United to bed quite easily.

‘If Liverpool’s front three are firing I think they are going to be way too much for the back four of United.

‘And Liverpool’s defence will cope a lot easier with what United have to throw at them, even though they’re the away side.

‘If United get an embarrassing result then I think it could be the end for Solskjaer, but I don’t think that will happen.

‘I don’t think it will be a thrashing, maybe 2-0 to Liverpool, but Solskjaer is going to have to turn around results soon, because the board are going to start running out of patience.’
